model

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Resource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Book, DVD, Laptop

    public abstract class Resource
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a resource that the library has to offer. A resource is a certain book, DVD, type of laptop, etc. and consists of multiple copies that can be borrowed or requested. It has a unique ID, a title, the year it came out and a thumbnail image.
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Kane Miles, Alexandru Dascalu

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Copy> copyList
      A list of all the copies of this resource.
      private java.util.LinkedList<Copy> freeCopies
      A list of all copies of this resource that are not currently borrowed.
      private static long MILLISECONDS_IN_DAY
      Number of milliseconds in a day.
      private java.util.PriorityQueue<Copy> noDueDateCopies
      A queue of all borrowed copies who have no due date set.
      private java.util.ArrayList<User> pendingRequests
      A list of users with pending requests to borrow a copy of this resource that need to be authorised by a librarian.
      protected static java.util.ArrayList<Resource> resources
      A list of all resources in the application.
      protected javafx.scene.image.Image thumbnail
      The thumbnail Image of this resource.
      protected java.lang.String title
      The title of this resource.
      protected int uniqueID
      A unique number that identifies this resource.
      private Queue<User> userRequestQueue
      A queue of user who have requested a copy of this resource but have not gotten one because there is no free copy.
      protected int year
      The year this resource came out.

    • Field Detail

      • MILLISECONDS_IN_DAY

        private static final long MILLISECONDS_IN_DAY
        Number of milliseconds in a day. Used when calculating the number of days a copy is overdue. Its value is 86400000L.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        title - The title of this resource.
        year - The year this resource appeared.
        thumbnail - A small image of this resource.

      • processReturn

        public void processReturn(Copy returnedCopy)
        This method ensures a returned copy is marked a free copy or that it is reserved for the user at the front of the request queue. It also ensures that any fines that need to be applied are added to the database.
        Parameters:
        returnedCopy - The copy being returned.

      • loanToUser

        public boolean loanToUser(User user)
        Ensures a copy is loaned to the given user if there are available copies, else it adds the user to the request queue.
        Parameters:
        user - The user that wants to borrow a copy of this resource.
        Returns:
        If the user has the copy or is in the queue (false)

      • getCopyInformation

        public java.lang.String getCopyInformation()
        Returns a string with the unique ID and availability of each copy of this resource. The information of each copy is on each separate line.
        Returns:
        A string where each line of the unique ID and availability of a copy of this resource.

      • addPendingRequest

        public void addPendingRequest(User requester)

        Parameters:
        requester - The user wanting to borrow a copy of this resource.

      • getLikenessScore

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an integer representing how similar this resource is to the given resource.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String search)
        Determines if the title of this resource contains the given string.
        Parameters:
        search - The substring that will be searched for in the title.
        Returns:
        True if the given string is a substring of the title of this resource, false if not.

      • formatDate

        private java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date,
                                    java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateFormater)
        A wrapper function that returns a string representing a date, or null if the given date is null. Necessary because format method for DateFormat would throw an exception when given null.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to be converted to a string.
        dateFormater - The date formater to be used.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the date, or null if the date is null.
